intro: Heterotaxis sessilis, commonly known as the sessile heterotaxis, is a rare and distinctive member of the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its unique leaf arrangement, with leaves that are sessile and often arranged in a spiral pattern along the stem. The plant produces small, white to greenish flowers that are clustered in umbels, a common feature among members of its family. Its habitat is typically moist, shaded environments, often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
